Medical Studies: 
 
 A large long-term study with 7744 participants looked into sedentary behavior and risk of cardiovascular disease mortality in men over a 21 year period. It found sedentary behavior increased risk of death from cardiovascular disease by 64 percent to percent. 

 A Danish medical study that looked into factors which decreased life quality found sedentary lifestyles reduced the quality-adjusted life years by 7 years. 

 A British research study found that even exercising for 30 minutes or more a day might not be enough to counteract the negative effects of sitting for prolonged periods of time. 

 Sitting for prolonged periods of time may contribute to metabolic diseases such as diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
